00047 
00048 #ifndef _osconfig_
00049 #define _osconfig_
00050 
00051 /*
00052 ** Platform Configuration Parameters for the OS API
00053 */
00054 
00055 #define OS_MAX_TASKS                64
00056 #define OS_MAX_QUEUES               64
00057 #define OS_MAX_COUNT_SEMAPHORES     20
00058 #define OS_MAX_BIN_SEMAPHORES       20
00059 #define OS_MAX_MUTEXES              20
00060 
00061 /*
00062 ** Maximum length for an absolute path name
00063 */
00064 #define OS_MAX_PATH_LEN     64
00065 
00066 /*
00067 ** Maximum length for a local or host path/filename.
00068 **   This parameter can consist of the OSAL filename/path + 
00069 **   the host OS physical volume name or path.
00070 */
00071 #define OS_MAX_LOCAL_PATH_LEN (OS_MAX_PATH_LEN + OS_FS_PHYS_NAME_LEN)
00072 
00073 /* 
00074 ** The maxium length allowed for a object (task,queue....) name 
00075 */
00076 #define OS_MAX_API_NAME     20
00077 
00078 /* 
00079 ** The maximum length for a file name 
00080 */
00081 #define OS_MAX_FILE_NAME    20
00082 
00083 /* 
00084 ** These defines are for OS_printf
00085 */
00086 #define OS_BUFFER_SIZE 172
00087 #define OS_BUFFER_MSG_DEPTH 100
00088 
00089 /* This #define turns on a utility task that
00090  * will read the statements to print from
00091  * the OS_printf function. If you want OS_printf
00092  * to print the text out itself, comment this out 
00093  * 
00094  * NOTE: The Utility Task #defines only have meaning 
00095  * on the VxWorks operating systems
00096  */
00097  
00098 #define OS_UTILITY_TASK_ON
00099 
00100 
00101 #ifdef OS_UTILITY_TASK_ON 
00102     #define OS_UTILITYTASK_STACK_SIZE 2048
00103     /* some room is left for other lower priority tasks */
00104     #define OS_UTILITYTASK_PRIORITY   245
00105 #endif
00106 
00107 
00108 /* 
00109 ** the size of a command that can be passed to the underlying OS 
00110 */
00111 #define OS_MAX_CMD_LEN 1000
00112 
00113 /*
00114 ** This define will include the OS network API.
00115 ** It should be turned off for targtets that do not have a network stack or 
00116 ** device ( like the basic RAD750 vxWorks BSP )
00117 */
00118 #define OS_INCLUDE_NETWORK
00119 
00120 /* 
00121 ** This is the maximum number of open file descriptors allowed at a time 
00122 */
00123 #define OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES 50 
00124 
00125 /* 
00126 ** This defines the filethe input command of OS_ShellOutputToFile
00127 ** is written to in the VxWorks6 port 
00128 */
00129 #define OS_SHELL_CMD_INPUT_FILE_NAME "/ram/OS_ShellCmd.in"
00130 
00131 /* 
00132 ** This define sets the queue implentation of the Linux port to use sockets 
00133 ** commenting this out makes the Linux port use the POSIX message queues.
00134 */
00135 /* #define OSAL_SOCKET_QUEUE */
00136 
00137 /*
00138 ** Module loader/symbol table is optional
00139 */
00140 #define OS_INCLUDE_MODULE_LOADER
00141 
00142 #ifdef OS_INCLUDE_MODULE_LOADER
00143    /*
00144    ** This define sets the size of the OS Module Table, which keeps track of the loaded modules in 
00145    ** the running system. This define must be set high enough to support the maximum number of
00146    ** loadable modules in the system. If the the table is filled up at runtime, a new module load
00147    ** would fail.
00148    */
00149    #define OS_MAX_MODULES 32
00150 
00151    /*
00152    ** The Static Loader define is used for switching between the Dynamic and Static loader implementations.
00153    */
00154    /* #define OS_STATIC_LOADER */
00155 
00156 #endif
00157 
00158 
00159 /*
00160 ** This define sets the maximum symbol name string length. It is used in implementations that 
00161 ** support the symbols and symbol lookup.
00162 */
00163 #define OS_MAX_SYM_LEN 64
00164 
00165 
00166 /*
00167 ** This define sets the maximum number of timers available
00168 */
00169 #define OS_MAX_TIMERS         5
00170 
00171 #endif
